Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the given Euler angles and translation vector: * Euler Angles: [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] * Translation Vector: [0.0004, 0.7496, 0.0] Construct the following 2D sketch on the X-Y plane of the coordinate system: * Sketch face_1: + Loop_1: - Line_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.7496, 0.0] - Line_2: Start Point [0.7496, 0.0], End Point [0.7496, 0.7496] - Line_3: Start Point [0.7496, 0.7496], End Point [0.3748, 0.7496] - Line_4: Start Point [0.3748, 0.7496], End Point [0.3748, 0.3748] - Arc_1: Start Point [0.3748, 0.3748], Mid Point [0.1046, 0.2702], End Point [0.0, 0.0] The loop is closed and consists of one line and one arc. After creating the 2D sketch, scale the sketch using the scaling parameter `sketch_scale` (0.7496). Then, transform the scaled 2D sketch into 3D using the euler angles and translation vector from the coordinate system.
